text: Example 5.2. Suppose our list contains n integers between 0 and 255 inclu- sive. Let’s use base b = 2 so that we need d = 8 of them. If we use Radix- Sort+CountingSort then the underlying CountingSort has £ = max = 1 and therefore is ©(n +1) and so the resulting RadixSort will be ©(8(n+1)) = ©(n).
